intro: Memecylon torricellense var. coccineum, commonly known as the crimson memecylon, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its attractive, showy red flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a glossy appearance. The flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences and are pollinated primarily by birds and insects.
